metadata.Title: CVE-2023-32247 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's ksmbd, a high-performance in-kernelSMB server. The specific flaw exists within the handling ofSMB2_SESSION_SETUP commands. The issue results from the lack of control ofresource consumption. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to createa denial-of-service condition on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-32247` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-1014-oem - 6.1.0-1014.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1011-aws - 6.2.0-1011.11~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-32-generic - 6.2.0-32.32~22.04.1
linux-image-6.2.0-32-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-32.32~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-32-generic - 6.2.0-32.32~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-32-generic-64k - 6.2.0-32.32~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1012-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1012.12~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1012-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1012.12~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1013-gcp - 6.2.0-1013.13~22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2, was needed').
linux-kvm package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-allwinner-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needed').
linux-aws package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-6.2, was needs-triage').
